g.text: Do Not Cite, Quote or Distribute
generational justice concerns, such as the impacts of policy decisions on future generations
A just transition could therefore entail that the state intervenes more actively in the eradication of
poverty, and creates jobs in lower
carbon sectors, in part to compensate for
based sectors, and that governments, polluting industries, corporations and those more able
to pay higher associated taxes pay for transition costs, provide a welfare safety net and adequate
ities, places, and regions that have been impacted by pollution,
marginalised or negatively impacted by a transition from a high
(Muttitt and Kartha 2020; Le Billon and Kristoffersen 2020; Kartha et al. 2018b)
impacts is another important dimension of equity, in that the poor who are least responsible for climate
change are most vulnerable to its impacts (WGII, Chapter 8).
distinction between losses incurred by corporations and states and
losses experienced by workers and communities. Processes established in the name of a just transition
are also at risk of being co
opted by incumbent interests and powerful/wealthy agents (
). Policy interventions associated with good governance, democratic oversight, and legal
recourse can help overcome attempted co
optation of just transition, or use of COVID
The just transition concept has thus become an international focal point tying together social
movements, trade unions, and other key stakeholders to ensure equity is better accounted for i
carbon transitions and to seek to protect workers and communities. It also forms a central pillar of the
growing movement for a ‘Green New Deal’
a roadmap for a broad spectrum of policies, programs,
and legislation that aims to rapidly decarbonises t
he economy while significantly reducing economic
The US Green New Deal Resolution
for example positions structural inequality, poverty mitigation, and a just transition at its
billion “Just Transition Mechanism” to mitigate the social effects of transitioning away from jobs in
fossil based industries. National level green new deals with strong just transition components have been
proposed in South Korea, Australia, Spain, UK
, Puerto Rico, Canada, as well as regional proposals
across Latin America and the Caribbean
Selected organisations and movements supporting a just transition
Asian Pacific Forum on Women, Law and
National Union of Mineworkers of South
